00021 #include "file/TsvFile/SequentialClfFile.h"
00022 //
00023 #include <cassert>
00024 //
00025 
00026 
00030 SequentialClfFile::SequentialClfFile(void)
00031     : m_Rows(0), m_Cols(0)
00032 {}
00033 
00040 bool SequentialClfFile::isSequential(affx::TsvFile& clfTsv)
00041 {
00042   std::string rowsValue, colsValue, sequentialValue;
00043   clfTsv.headersFindNext("rows", rowsValue);
00044   clfTsv.headersFindNext("cols", colsValue);
00045   clfTsv.headersFindNext("sequential", sequentialValue);
00046   // Require rows, cols, and a sequential value of 1.
00047   if (rowsValue.empty() || colsValue.empty() || sequentialValue != "1")
00048     return false;
00049   // Save rows, cols.
00050   m_Rows = Convert::toInt(rowsValue);
00051   m_Cols = Convert::toInt(colsValue);
00052   return true;
00053 }
00054 
00062 void SequentialClfFile::getProbeCoordinates(const int probeId, int& x, int& y)
00063 {
00064   // Probe id is one based, x and y are zero based.
00065   const int id = probeId - 1;
00066   x = id % m_Rows;
00067   assert(m_Cols > 0);
00068   y = id / m_Cols;
00069 }
